analyzed: ston pa ni dor bar bya ba nyid yin pas so //
translated: Because the teacher is what is to be discarded.

original: rigs kyi 'dom pa sel ba zhes bya ba sbyor ba dang po rdzogs so /
analyzed: rigs kyi 'dom pa sel ba zhes bya ba sbyor ba dang po rdzogs so /
translated: The first chapter called “The Elimination of the Misconception about the Family” is complete.

original: // / de ltar rigs kyi 'dom pa bsal nas dus kyi 'dom pa ma bsal na khyad par mi shes pa'i phyir /
analyzed: // / de ltar rigs kyi 'dom pa bsal nas dus kyi 'dom pa ma bsal na khyad par mi shes pa'i phyir /
translated: Having thus eliminated the misconception about the family, if one does not eliminate the misconception about time, one will not understand the distinctions.

original: dus kyi 'dom pa sel ba ni //
analyzed: dus kyi 'dom pa sel ba ni //
translated: Therefore, in order to eliminate the misconception about time,🔽it is taught:🔽The teaching of the characteristics of the three times

original: rang gi mtshan nyid ston pa yin //🔽zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid ston pa yin // zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: is the teaching of one’s own characteristics.

original: da ni dus sel ba gnyis gsungs pa de rgyas par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni dus sel ba gnyis gsungs pa de rgyas par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to extensively teach the two eliminations of time that were mentioned,🔽first, the definition of the concise time:

original: dang po bsdus pa'i dus kyi nges tshig / gnyis dang rnams grangs sogs rnams kyi //
analyzed: dang po bsdus pa'i dus kyi nges tshig / gnyis dang rnams grangs sogs rnams kyi //
translated: In the case of the two and the enumeration, etc.,

original: gang du byed tshig mi gnas pa //
analyzed: gang du byed tshig mi gnas pa //
translated: where the verbal root does not occur,

original: de ni mdo ru bsdus pa ste //🔽zhes gsungs @238a * //
analyzed: de ni mdo ru bsdus pa ste // zhes gsungs @238a * //
translated: that is called a sūtra.

original: te ; mdo tsam gyi tshig dang bye brag rnam par 'byed pa'i tshig gi bar na byed pa'i tshig mi gnas na bsdus pa zhes bya ba'i ming du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: te ; mdo tsam gyi tshig dang bye brag rnam par 'byed pa'i tshig gi bar na byed pa'i tshig mi gnas na bsdus pa zhes bya ba'i ming du 'gyur ro //
translated: If the verbal root does not occur between the words of mere sūtra and the words that distinguish the specific, it is called “concise.”

original: de yang dus yod pa dang gang gang ba yin pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de yang dus yod pa dang gang gang ba yin pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that time exists and what it is, he says:

original: mdor bsdus de yang bcu bzhir 'dod //
analyzed: mdor bsdus de yang bcu bzhir 'dod //
translated: In brief, it is held to be fourteenfold.🔽Two words, synonyms,🔽different words and meanings, six verbal roots,

original: tshig gnyis dang ni rnam grangs dang // tshig don gzhan dang byed tshig drug / khyad par dang ni 'bru mang po //
analyzed: tshig gnyis dang ni rnam grangs dang // tshig don gzhan dang byed tshig drug / khyad par dang ni 'bru mang po //
translated: distinctions, and many particles

original: bye brag gzhi bsdu gcig tu bsdu //
analyzed: bye brag gzhi bsdu gcig tu bsdu //
translated: are included in the basis of grammar.

original: zlas dbye ba gnyis de'i skyes bu //
analyzed: zlas dbye ba gnyis de'i skyes bu //
translated: The two types of compound are dvandva and tatpurusa.

original: zad par mi 'gyur las 'dzin yin //🔽zhes smos te /
analyzed: zad par mi 'gyur las 'dzin yin // zhes smos te /
translated: The two types of indeclinable are indeclinables that do not change and indeclinables that take on case endings.🔽The two types of verbal root are verbal roots that do not change and verbal roots that change.

original: de la ming gnyis kyis byed pa gcig sdud pa ste /
analyzed: de la ming gnyis kyis byed pa gcig sdud pa ste /
translated: In this regard, two words that combine one action are:

original: de yang mya ngan las 'das pa'i rnam par thar pa ni rnam thar zhes pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: de yang mya ngan las 'das pa'i rnam par thar pa ni rnam thar zhes pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, nirvana-liberation is “liberation.”

original: mang po'i bar gyi byed pa phyis pa ni rnam grangs kyis mdor bsdus pa ste /
analyzed: mang po'i bar gyi byed pa phyis pa ni rnam grangs kyis mdor bsdus pa ste /
translated: The combining of many actions later is by synonyms:

original: de yang drang srong mnyan pa dang yod pas dang po bzung ba'i yul ni mnyan yod ces pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: de yang drang srong mnyan pa dang yod pas dang po bzung ba'i yul ni mnyan yod ces pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the place first seized by the seer and the existent is “Sravasti.”

original: tshig gang rang gi don mi ston par don 'pho ba na tshig don gzhan gyis mdor bsdus pa ste /
analyzed: tshig gang rang gi don mi ston par don 'pho ba na tshig don gzhan gyis mdor bsdus pa ste /
translated: A word that does not express its own meaning but expresses another meaning is a word that is summarized by another word.

original: de yang nor lha'i bu la 'khor lo yod pas 'khor lo can zhes 'bod pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: de yang nor lha'i bu la 'khor lo yod pas 'khor lo can zhes 'bod pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the son of Vaisravana is called Cakravartin because he has a wheel.

original: las dang / byed pa dang / sbyin pa dang / bslang ba dang / sgrub pa dang / gzhi rnams ni byed pa'i tshig drug ste /
analyzed: las dang / byed pa dang / sbyin pa dang / bslang ba dang / sgrub pa dang / gzhi rnams ni byed pa'i tshig drug ste /
translated: The six verbal actions are action, instrument, benefaction, motion, accomplishment, and basis.

original: de dag bsdus pa ni byed tshig drug gi mdor bsdus pa ste /🔽de yang chos la spyod pa ni chos spyod ces bya ba nas /
analyzed: de dag bsdus pa ni byed tshig drug gi mdor bsdus pa ste / de yang chos la spyod pa ni chos spyod ces bya ba nas /
translated: A summary of those six verbal actions is a summary by six verbal actions.

original: chos la brten pa ni chos brten zhes bya ba'i bar lta bur rig par bya'o //
analyzed: chos la brten pa ni chos brten zhes bya ba'i bar lta bur rig par bya'o //
translated: For example, one who practices the Dharma is called a Dharma practitioner, and so on, up to one who relies on the Dharma is called a Dharma supporter.

original: ngo bo nyid kyi tshig dang khyad par gyi tshig gi bar na gnas gzhan spong ba'i tshig phyi nas mu gsum dang gnyis gcod bar byed pa ni khyad par gyis mdor bsdus pa ste /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyi tshig dang khyad par gyi tshig gi bar na gnas gzhan spong ba'i tshig phyi nas mu gsum dang gnyis gcod bar byed pa ni khyad par gyis mdor bsdus pa ste /
translated: A summary by distinction is a word that cuts off the three or two alternatives after the other location is eliminated between a word of intrinsic nature and a word of distinction.🔽For example, a word of intrinsic nature is a word that cuts off the three alternatives, such as “This is a tree,” “This is not a tree,” and “This is and is not a tree.”

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das dang / lha dbang phyug dang / 'byung ba sa kha dog dkar zhes pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das dang / lha dbang phyug dang / 'byung ba sa kha dog dkar zhes pa lta bu ste /
translated: For example, Buddha Bhagavan, Isvara, and the color white of the element earth.

original: ji ltar gcod pa'i rim pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ji ltar gcod pa'i rim pa bzhin no //
translated: They are like the order of the words in the expression the killing of deer.

original: 'di dag ni mdor bsdus ba lnga zhes slob dpon kha cig 'chad do //
analyzed: 'di dag ni mdor bsdus ba lnga zhes slob dpon kha cig 'chad do //
translated: Some masters explain: These are the five brief nominal bases.

original: spyir ni mdor bsdus pa 'di dag kyang don gyi dbang re res bkod kyi thams cad kyi thams cad du tha dad pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: spyir ni mdor bsdus pa 'di dag kyang don gyi dbang re res bkod kyi thams cad kyi thams cad du tha dad pa ni ma yin te /
translated: In general, these brief nominal bases are established by the power of each meaning, but they are not different in every way.

original: 'bru mang po pa dang / tshig don gzhan lta bu dang / de'i skyes bu dang / byed pa drug lta bu ni phyogs gcig mi 'dra ba'i dbang yin no //
analyzed: 'bru mang po pa dang / tshig don gzhan lta bu dang / de'i skyes bu dang / byed pa drug lta bu ni phyogs gcig mi 'dra ba'i dbang yin no //
translated: For example, the words many grains and different meanings and his man and the six actions are established by the power of the difference of one part.

original: bye brag dang khyad par ni sgra mi 'dra ba'i dbang yin no //
analyzed: bye brag dang khyad par ni sgra mi 'dra ba'i dbang yin no //
translated: The words particular and distinction are established by the power of the difference of sound.

original: rjes su @238b zlos pa'i zlas dbye ba lta bu ni don mi 'dra ba'i dbang yin no //
analyzed: rjes su @238b zlos pa'i zlas dbye ba lta bu ni don mi 'dra ba'i dbang yin no //
translated: For example, the words the repetition of the repetition are established by the power of the difference of meaning.

original: gzhi mthun pa dang de'i skyes bu lta bu ni thams cad mi 'dra ba'i dbang yin no //
analyzed: gzhi mthun pa dang de'i skyes bu lta bu ni thams cad mi 'dra ba'i dbang yin no //
translated: For example, the words common locus and his man are established by the power of the difference of all.

original: de yang gang la 'bru mang po yod pa de ni 'bru mang po ba ste /
analyzed: de yang gang la 'bru mang po yod pa de ni 'bru mang po ba ste /
translated: That which has many grains is called “having many grains.”

original: 'di ltar ba khra mo can zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar ba khra mo can zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, “having a variegated color.”

original: gang la rang gi bye brag bsdus pa de ni bye brag bsdus pa ste /
analyzed: gang la rang gi bye brag bsdus pa de ni bye brag bsdus pa ste /
translated: That which includes its own specific attributes is called “including specific attributes.”

original: de yang autpal sngon po lta bu'o //
analyzed: de yang autpal sngon po lta bu'o //
translated: For example, “like a blue lotus.”

original: gang dus sam dngos po gzhan sdud pa de ni gzhi bsdu ba ste /
analyzed: gang dus sam dngos po gzhan sdud pa de ni gzhi bsdu ba ste /
translated: That which includes time or another thing is called “including a basis.”

original: de yang lha la sogs pa rnams zhes pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: de yang lha la sogs pa rnams zhes pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, “gods and so on.”

original: gang tshogs pa gtso bor sgrub cing gzhi mthun par sdud pa ni gzhi gcig tu bsdu pa ste /
analyzed: gang tshogs pa gtso bor sgrub cing gzhi mthun par sdud pa ni gzhi gcig tu bsdu pa ste /
translated: That which establishes a collection as primary and includes a common basis is called “including a single basis.”

original: de yang 'di ni aa ru ra smin pa dag ces pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: de yang 'di ni aa ru ra smin pa dag ces pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, “these are ripe myrobalan fruits.”

original: gang gcig bstan na gcig shes pa de ni zlas dbye ba ste /
analyzed: gang gcig bstan na gcig shes pa de ni zlas dbye ba ste /
translated: That which is understood when one thing is indicated is called “a contrast.”

original: de yang mthun pa shes pa dang mi mthun pa shes pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de yang mthun pa shes pa dang mi mthun pa shes pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two: understanding a concordant example and understanding a discordant example.

original: 'di ltar lam 'khyog pa ngal ba'i rgyur bstan na lam mi bde ba 'ang ngal ba'i rgyur shes pa dang / lam drang ba bde ba sems pa'i rgyur yang shes pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar lam 'khyog pa ngal ba'i rgyur bstan na lam mi bde ba 'ang ngal ba'i rgyur shes pa dang / lam drang ba bde ba sems pa'i rgyur yang shes pa lta bu'o //
translated: Thus, if a crooked path is taught to be the cause of fatigue, then an uncomfortable path is also known to be the cause of fatigue, and a straight path is known to be the cause of comfort.

original: ba ni rtogs pa'i phyir thams cad du yang gnyis par 'gyur ba yin mod kyi /
analyzed: ba ni rtogs pa'i phyir thams cad du yang gnyis par 'gyur ba yin mod kyi /
translated: The suffix “ta” is used to indicate the second case in all instances.

original: 'dir ni rnam grangs dang bsdus pa'i gnyis dang ldan pa'i tshig de ni ba gnyis pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir ni rnam grangs dang bsdus pa'i gnyis dang ldan pa'i tshig de ni ba gnyis pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Here, the word “dvita” is used to indicate the second case in the sense of enumeration and inclusion.

original: de'i skyes bu ni tva ta hvom too ma pu ru she na tad pu ru sha ste dngos po gzhan dang gzhan du sbyar ba de'i skyes bu'o //
analyzed: de'i skyes bu ni tva ta hvom too ma pu ru she na tad pu ru sha ste dngos po gzhan dang gzhan du sbyar ba de'i skyes bu'o //
translated: The person in that [case] is called “tavahvamato mapurusha,” meaning the person who is connected to another thing.

original: gang mtha' mi 'jed pa'i tshig ni zad par mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gang mtha' mi 'jed pa'i tshig ni zad par mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The word “akṣaya” means inexhaustible.

original: gang gzhi gcig gis gzhi nyid dang byed pa gzhan gyis las su gyur pa yang sgrub pa de ni las 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gzhi gcig gis gzhi nyid dang byed pa gzhan gyis las su gyur pa yang sgrub pa de ni las 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: That which is accomplished by one basis being the basis itself and another action being the action is called “karmadhāraya.”

original: de rnams ni dus gnyis bkod pa las bsdus pa'i dus yin no //
analyzed: de rnams ni dus gnyis bkod pa las bsdus pa'i dus yin no //
translated: These are the included cases in the arrangement of the two times.

original: da ni byed pa'i tshig dang ldan pa'i dus bshad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni byed pa'i tshig dang ldan pa'i dus bshad pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to explain the time of the verbal root, he says:

original: byed pa'i dus ni de nyid la //
analyzed: byed pa'i dus ni de nyid la //
translated: The time of the verbal root is in that very

original: the tshom gcod byed 'dus byas yin //🔽zhes smos te /
analyzed: the tshom gcod byed 'dus byas yin // zhes smos te /
translated: compound, which is conditioned and cuts off doubt.

original: bsdus pa de dag nyid legs par sbyar ba'i phyir 'dus byas yin no //
analyzed: bsdus pa de dag nyid legs par sbyar ba'i phyir 'dus byas yin no //
translated: In order to properly compound those very compounds, it is conditioned.

original: de yang gang yin pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de yang gang yin pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: And in order to demonstrate that, he says:🔽Action, agent, purpose, source, connection,

original: de yang las dang byed pa dang // ched dang 'byung khungs 'brel ba dang // gzhi dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de yang las dang byed pa dang // ched dang 'byung khungs 'brel ba dang // gzhi dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: basis, and so on.

original: de yang las zhes bya ba ni gang dag tshogs pa 'dus pa'i dus na gang gis mngon par 'du byed pa dang / gang la mngon par 'du bya ba'i gzhi dang / gang zhig mngon par 'du bya ba rnams ni las yin te /
analyzed: de yang las zhes bya ba ni gang dag tshogs pa 'dus pa'i dus na gang gis mngon par 'du byed pa dang / gang la mngon par 'du bya ba'i gzhi dang / gang zhig mngon par 'du bya ba rnams ni las yin te /
translated: Action refers to that by which there is manifest formation at the time of the assembly of the collection, the basis of what is to be manifestly formed, and that which is to be manifestly formed.

original: gang g-yo ba'am /
analyzed: gang g-yo ba'am /
translated: That which moves or

original: rtsol @239a * //
analyzed: rtsol @239a * //
translated: strives

analyzed: ba'am / snga ma'i gnas las gyur par byas pa'i phyir de yang mtshan nyid dang rnam par gzhag pa'i tshe na ni byed pa la yod pa'i g-yo ba'am rtsol ba las su gzung ngo //
translated: and the latter is the action of the agent.🔽When the action is posited as existing in the agent, it is the movement or exertion that exists in the agent that is taken to be the action.

original: byed pa dang rnam par gzhag pa'i tshe na ni bya ba'i gzhi la yod pa'i snga ma'i gnas las gyur pa las su gzung ngo //
analyzed: byed pa dang rnam par gzhag pa'i tshe na ni bya ba'i gzhi la yod pa'i snga ma'i gnas las gyur pa las su gzung ngo //
translated: When the action is posited as existing in the basis of the action, it is the change in the prior state that exists in the basis of the action that is taken to be the action.

original: bya ba dang rnam par gzhag pa'i tshe na ni bya ba'i gzhi dang bya ba nyid gnyis ka bya bar gzung ste /
analyzed: bya ba dang rnam par gzhag pa'i tshe na ni bya ba'i gzhi dang bya ba nyid gnyis ka bya bar gzung ste /
translated: When the action is posited as existing in the basis of the action and the action itself, it is both the basis of the action and the action itself that are taken to be the action.

original: las ni byed pa la yod pa'i g-yo rtsal du gzung ngo //
analyzed: las ni byed pa la yod pa'i g-yo rtsal du gzung ngo //
translated: The action is taken to be the movement and exertion that exist in the agent.

original: 'dir ni rnam par dbye ba ston pa'i don yin pas byed pa dang rnam par gzhag pa'i las nyid gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir ni rnam par dbye ba ston pa'i don yin pas byed pa dang rnam par gzhag pa'i las nyid gzung bar bya'o //
translated: Here, since the point is to teach the classification, the action itself that is posited as existing in the agent and the basis of the action should be taken.

original: de yang 'bras bu'am /
analyzed: de yang 'bras bu'am /
translated: Moreover, the four—result,

original: don dang dgos ched lta bu dang / gnas sam ldan par byed pa dang phrad pa rnams ni bzhi pa'am /
analyzed: don dang dgos ched lta bu dang / gnas sam ldan par byed pa dang phrad pa rnams ni bzhi pa'am /
translated: purpose, reason, and basis or endowment—are the fourth.

original: bdun pa'i don yin pas de ni 'dir 'gog go //
analyzed: bdun pa'i don yin pas de ni 'dir 'gog go //
translated: The meaning of the seventh case is the meaning of the locative case, and that is refuted here.

original: spyi'i dbye ba ni byed pa'i don gyis shes par bya'o //
analyzed: spyi'i dbye ba ni byed pa'i don gyis shes par bya'o //
translated: The general classification should be understood by the meaning of the agent.

original: byed pa ni byed pa po dang bcas pa ste /
analyzed: byed pa ni byed pa po dang bcas pa ste /
translated: The agent is together with the agent.

original: de yang rab tu skyed par byed pa dang / rnam par 'jog par byed pa dang / shes bya shes par byed pa rnams so //
analyzed: de yang rab tu skyed par byed pa dang / rnam par 'jog par byed pa dang / shes bya shes par byed pa rnams so //
translated: Moreover, it is the one who generates, the one who establishes, and the one who causes the object of knowledge to be known.

original: de dag kyang gcig dang du ma'i sgo nas mu bzhi ste /
analyzed: de dag kyang gcig dang du ma'i sgo nas mu bzhi ste /
translated: Those are four possibilities from the perspective of one and many.

translated: The generation of one effect by many such as the object of observation, the immediately preceding condition, and the dominant condition, and the generation of one effect such as the four elements and the element of time by many is the performance of an action by many with regard to one.

translated: For example, the eye sense faculty generates eye consciousness that is similar to it in terms of focal object, it generates eye consciousness in the same type of consciousness and it generates eye consciousness in the nature of apprehending its object.🔽For example, the primary elements act on many things in many ways, such as supporting, contracting, maturing, not rotting,

original: rim gyis 'phel ba dang / cha mnyam par skyed pa lta bu ni du ma du ma la byed pa lta bu yin no //
analyzed: rim gyis 'phel ba dang / cha mnyam par skyed pa lta bu ni du ma du ma la byed pa lta bu yin no //
translated: gradually increasing and generating an equal share.

original: kun gzhi lta bu rnam par shes pa kun skyed pa dang / ma rig pa lta bu las dang sdug bsngal kun skyed pa dang / sa bon lta bu ga lo ma la sogs pa skyed pa lta bu ni gcig du ma la byed pa lta bu'o /

translated: For example, the foundation consciousness generates all consciousnesses, ignorance generates all karma and suffering and seeds generate leaves and so on.

analyzed: lhag ma gang gi yin zhes 'dri ba'i tshe na ni bdag gi yin zhes bya bar 'gyur te /

analyzed: brgyud pa'i dus su snga ma 'og 'dril te sel to //

original: las brten pa'i gnas gzhi la yang bzhi ste /
analyzed: las brten pa'i gnas gzhi la yang bzhi ste /

original: yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba'i las brten pa me dang chu la sreg pa dang spangs par byed ces pa lta bu dang / yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba'i las brten pa me dang chu dang dgra la sreg pa dang sdug bsngal ba dang 'jig par byed ces pa lta bu dang /

translated: The action that is both is the action that is based on the foundation of suffering that is beneficial, such as bloodletting and cauterization. original: mthu la brten pa'i gnas gzhi la yang bzhi ste /
analyzed: mthu la brten pa'i gnas gzhi la yang bzhi ste /
translated: The four based on power are:

original: ngo bo tha dad pa'i mthu la brten pa rgyal po la brten pa rgyal po'i mi zhes pa lta bu dang / dus tha dad pa'i mthu la brten ba sa bon la brten pa myu gu zhes pa lta bu dang / tha mi dad pa'i mthu la brten pa de bzhin gshegs pa ni so so rang rig pa'i ye shes la gnas zhes pa lta bu dang /

translated: The action based on the power of a different entity is like saying, “The king’s man.” The action based on the power of a different time is like saying, “The sprout of the seed.” The action based on the power of nondifference is like saying, “The Tathāgata abides in the wisdom of individual intuitive awareness.”

original: gnyis ka ma yin pa'i mthu la brten pa kun gzhi la bag chags gnas zhes pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: gnyis ka ma yin pa'i mthu la brten pa kun gzhi la bag chags gnas zhes pa lta bu'o //
translated: The action based on the power of neither is like saying, “The latent propensities abide in the foundation.”

original: ldan pa brten pa'i gnas gzhi yang bzhi ste /
analyzed: ldan pa brten pa'i gnas gzhi yang bzhi ste /
translated: There are four bases of dependent predication that are endowed with the property of being predicated:🔽endowed with a compatible factor, as in Devadatta has wealth and an army;🔽endowed with an incompatible factor, as in Devadatta has enemies;

original: mthun pa'i phyogs ldan pa lhas byin la nor zas dang dpung yod ces pa lta bu dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs ldan pa lhas byin la dgra yod ces pa lta bu dang / gnyis ka ma ldan pa lhas byin la rta ngan pa yod ces ba lta bu dang /

translated: endowed with neither, as in Devadatta has a bad horse;

analyzed: gnyis ka ma yin pa ldan pa lhas byin la rdzas dgos pa med pa yod do zhes pa lta bu'o //

analyzed: de dag bod pa dang don tsam bsdus pa dang bcas pa ni gnas brgyad de /

analyzed: rjod par byed pa'i byed tshig dag kyang der 'du ste /

original: zla bsdu lhag ma bcas pa dang // dgag sgrub brnan dang bdag po dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgya cher smos so //
analyzed: zla bsdu lhag ma bcas pa dang // dgag sgrub brnan dang bdag po dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgya cher smos so //
translated: the negation, the affirmation, the addition, the predominance.

analyzed: de la zla bsdu zhes bya ba ni zla sdud pa'i tshig ste /
translated: Among them, the repetition of the moon is the expression of the repetition of the moon.

analyzed: gang zhig dam bcas pa'i don spyi dang khyad par dag gis bstan par bya ba rdzogs so zhes bya bas bstan du rung ba dag go //

original: tshig lhag ma can ni lhag bcas te /
analyzed: tshig lhag ma can ni lhag bcas te /
translated: The remainder is that which has a remainder.

original: lhag ma ni don gyis kha skong ba'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni don gyis kha skong ba'o //
translated: The remainder is the supplementation of the meaning.

original: de gang la yod pa de ni lhag ma dang bcas pa ste /
analyzed: de gang la yod pa de ni lhag ma dang bcas pa ste /

analyzed: 'di ltar dper na lhas byin shing gcod de zhes bya ba gzhan 'dren pa lta bu dag go //
translated: For example, it is like Devadatta cuts the tree which leads to another.

original: dgag pa zhes bya ba ni 'gog par byed pa ste /
analyzed: dgag pa zhes bya ba ni 'gog par byed pa ste /
translated: The negation is the negation.

original: ji ltar zhe na med pa dang / ma yin par ro //
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na med pa dang / ma yin par ro //
translated: How is it? By non-existence and non-being.

original: 'di'i khyad par ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'di'i khyad par ci zhe na /

original: dgag par bya bas bye brag tu 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: dgag par bya bas bye brag tu 'gyur gyi /
translated: It is distinguished by the negatee,

original: 'gegs par byed pas ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'gegs par byed pas ni ma yin te /
translated: not by the negator.

original: mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi nus pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: dgag par bya ba nyid med pa yang gnyis ka la brjod du rung ste /
translated: The negation of the non-existent is also suitable to be expressed in both ways.

analyzed: gzhi'i bye brag bsnan par byas ba dngos po med pa zhig 'gegs par byed bas ston pa ni med par dgag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: When the negation of a non-existent thing is expressed by adding a particular basis, it is called a non-affirming negation.

analyzed: dngos po yod pa zhig 'gegs par byed pa'i tshig gis ston na ni ma yin par dgag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: When the negation of an existent thing is expressed by a negating word, it is called an affirming negation.

analyzed: de yang med pa rnams bzhir bstan pa dag las gtan med pa dang zhig nas med pa ston pa ni med pa'o //
translated: Moreover, among the four types of non-existence that have been taught, the teaching of complete non-existence and non-existence after destruction is non-existence.

original: snga na med pa dang gcig la gcig med pa dag ni rang gi rang gi rten mi 'dor bsam yin pa yin no //
analyzed: snga na med pa dang gcig la gcig med pa dag ni rang gi rang gi rten mi 'dor bsam yin pa yin no //
translated: Prior non-existence and mutual non-existence are not abandoned by their own respective supports.

original: ma yin pa de dag kyang bye brag gis na gnyen po dang mi mthun pa dang chung ba dang / mi 'dra ba dang dman pa rnams su 'gyur te /
analyzed: ma yin pa de dag kyang bye brag gis na gnyen po dang mi mthun pa dang chung ba dang / mi 'dra ba dang dman pa rnams su 'gyur te /
translated: Those non-existences, by their distinctions, are antidotes, incompatibilities, lesser, dissimilar, and inferior.

original: 'gegs pa'i tshig gis de lta bu dag yin par ston to //
analyzed: 'gegs pa'i tshig gis de lta bu dag yin par ston to //
translated: Those are taught by negating words in that way.

analyzed: de'i phyir dgag pa dang bcas pas bstan par bya bas bye brag phye zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

original: ci'i phyir dgag pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir dgag pa zhes bya zhe na /

analyzed: 'di dag dang ldan pa gang dag ldog par mi 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir ro //

original: sgrub pa zhes bya ba ni sgrub par byed pa'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa zhes bya ba ni sgrub par byed pa'o //

original: don gang zhig bsgrub par bya ba 'di dag yod na ldog par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don gang zhig bsgrub par bya ba 'di dag yod na ldog par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If these exist, it is not possible to reverse the object to be affirmed.

original: ldog pa dang mi ldog pa'i bye brag ci zhe na /
analyzed: ldog pa dang mi ldog pa'i bye brag ci zhe na /
translated: What is the difference between reversal and non-reversal?

original: gang zhig yod pa yod do //
analyzed: gang zhig yod pa yod do //
translated: If it exists, it exists.

original: med pa med do //
analyzed: med pa med do //
translated: If it does not exist, it does not exist.

original: med pa yang yod do zhes brjod na med pa'i tshig gis rang dang gnyis ka ldog par byed do //
analyzed: med pa yang yod do zhes brjod na med pa'i tshig gis rang dang gnyis ka ldog par byed do //
translated: If it is said that a non-existent exists, the word non-existent reverses itself and the other.

original: yod pa'i tshig gis ni rang dang gzhan gnyis ka sgrub @241a * //🔽par byed de /
analyzed: yod pa'i tshig gis ni rang dang gzhan gnyis ka sgrub @241a * // par byed de /
translated: The word existent affirms itself and the other.

original: de'i phyir de dag dgag pa dang sgrub par ming 'dogs par byed do //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag dgag pa dang sgrub par ming 'dogs par byed do //
translated: Therefore, they are designated as negative and affirmative.

original: brnan pa ni ngo bo nyid dang rnam grangs so //
analyzed: brnan pa ni ngo bo nyid dang rnam grangs so //
translated: The second is intrinsic nature and synonyms.

original: de la ngo bo nyid brnan pas ni gzhan gyis gzhan ston pa la sogs pa sel bar byed do //

analyzed: rnam grangs gzhan brnan pas ni de lta bu dge kyang yin pa la sogs bar 'gyur ro //

original: brnan pa'i sgra dgar bar 'gyur ba dag kyang yod de /
analyzed: brnan pa'i sgra dgar bar 'gyur ba dag kyang yod de /
translated: There are also words of emphasis that are not used in the sense of emphasis.

original: 'di ltar de la 'di ni zhes pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar de la 'di ni zhes pa lta bu'o //

analyzed: kha cig na zla las so //

original: bdag po la sogs pa ni bdag po ste /
analyzed: bdag po la sogs pa ni bdag po ste /

analyzed: bdag po'i don ni gang la de yod pa'i ming ni der brtags pa ste /
translated: The word “master” is figuratively applied to that which is the master.

analyzed: 'bru mang po pa dang / ba gnyis pa dang / de la phan pa'i rkyen can la sogs bar ston pa dag lta bu don 'pho ba rnams so //
translated: The words “many grains,” “two cows,” and “his son” are used in the sense of a collection.

original: gzhan yang / rgyan dang kha skong dus la 'jug / ces bya ba la tshig gi rgyan gyi gsum ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang / rgyan dang kha skong dus la 'jug / ces bya ba la tshig gi rgyan gyi gsum ste /
translated: Moreover, there are three types of ornament of words:

original: mthun pa dang mi mthun pa dang kha skong ba'o //
analyzed: mthun pa dang mi mthun pa dang kha skong ba'o //
translated: concordant, discordant, and supplementary.

original: de la mthun pa'i rgyan ni don mthun par ston pa'o //
analyzed: de la mthun pa'i rgyan ni don mthun par ston pa'o //
translated: The ornament of conformity is that which shows conformity.

original: mi mthun pa'i rgyan ni mi mthun yang bsgrub bya grub par ston pa ste khas len pa'i rgol ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i rgyan ni mi mthun yang bsgrub bya grub par ston pa ste khas len pa'i rgol ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The ornament of non-conformity is that which shows the establishment of the probandum even though there is non-conformity, such as the disputant who accepts.

original: kha skong ba ni gnyis te /
analyzed: kha skong ba ni gnyis te /
translated: The supplement is of two kinds:

original: rtsa ba skong ba dang tshig kha skong ba'o //
analyzed: rtsa ba skong ba dang tshig kha skong ba'o //
translated: the supplement of the root and the supplement of the words.

original: de la rtsa ba skong ba ni yi ge tshang bar byed pa rnams so //
analyzed: de la rtsa ba skong ba ni yi ge tshang bar byed pa rnams so //
translated: Among them, the supplement of the root is that which makes the letters complete.

original: tshig kha skong ba ni tshig dang tshig gi lhag ma dag go //
analyzed: tshig kha skong ba ni tshig dang tshig gi lhag ma dag go //
translated: The supplement of the words is the words and the remainder of the words.

original: dus la 'jug pa ni sgra gang gzhig gis 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba dang ma 'ongs pa ston par nus pa dag go //
analyzed: dus la 'jug pa ni sgra gang gzhig gis 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba dang ma 'ongs pa ston par nus pa dag go //
translated: The engagement in time is that which is able to show the past, present, and future by some sound.

original: 'byed sdud gzhan gcod gnyis pa dang / zhes bya ba la /🔽'byed pa dang sdud pa la sogs pa ston pa ste /
analyzed: 'byed sdud gzhan gcod gnyis pa dang / zhes bya ba la / 'byed pa dang sdud pa la sogs pa ston pa ste /
translated: The second is the division, inclusion, and exclusion of others.🔽Among them, the division is that which shows the division, such as the division of the three times.🔽The inclusion is that which shows the inclusion, such as the inclusion of the three times in the present.

original: 'byed cing sdud pa dang sdud cing 'byed pa dag go //🔽de dag ni ngo bo tha dad pa yang skabs kyi bya ba sdud pa dang ldan no //
analyzed: 'byed cing sdud pa dang sdud cing 'byed pa dag go //🔽de dag ni ngo bo tha dad pa yang skabs kyi bya ba sdud pa dang ldan no //
translated: The exclusion of others is that which shows the exclusion of others, such as the exclusion of the present from the past.

original: 'di ni dad dang yang gi sbyor ba can te /
analyzed: 'di ni dad dang yang gi sbyor ba can te /
translated: This is the particle and.

original: kha cig na rgyu'i don dang dus kyi bye brag dang gzhi'i don dang smra ba 'debs pa dang rtsa ba bskang ba rnams su yang byed do //
analyzed: kha cig na rgyu'i don dang dus kyi bye brag dang gzhi'i don dang smra ba 'debs pa dang rtsa ba bskang ba rnams su yang byed do //
translated: Some say that it is used for the meaning of cause, the distinction of time, the meaning of basis, the application of speech, and the completion of the root.

original: gang 'di yod na khyad par tha mi dad pa med do //
analyzed: gang 'di yod na khyad par tha mi dad pa med do //
translated: When this exists, there is no distinction without nondistinction.

original: sdud pa dag gis ni bshad par byas pa dang 'gyur ba dang gzhan don yin pa ni skabs kyi mthus yin gyi sgras ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sdud pa dag gis ni bshad par byas pa dang 'gyur ba dang gzhan don yin pa ni skabs kyi mthus yin gyi sgras ni ma yin no //
translated: The compilers have explained that the meaning of the particle and is that it is a statement, a transformation, and for the benefit of others, by the power of the context, not by the power of the word.

original: gzhan gcod pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan 'gegs pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan gcod pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan 'gegs pa ste /
translated: The socalled exclusion of others is the negation of others.

original: 'di ni dgag pa dang sgrub pa dag dang phyogs re re mthun pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni dgag pa dang sgrub pa dag dang phyogs re re mthun pa yin te /
translated: This is a negation and an affirmation that are partially similar.

original: 'di ni gang zhig gi rjes su brjod na de'i ma rigs spyi tsam du bsdus pa'am /
analyzed: 'di ni gang zhig gi rjes su brjod na de'i ma rigs spyi tsam du bsdus pa'am /
translated: When this is stated, it is a mere collection of the general class of that which is not reasonable.

original: rigs gcig @241b pa'i khyad par dag snga ma las gzhan pa'i 'gegs par byed de /
analyzed: rigs gcig @241b pa'i khyad par dag snga ma las gzhan pa'i 'gegs par byed de /
translated: Or it is the negation of a particular of the same class as the former.

original: de yang khyad par gyi gzhi la de brjod de /
analyzed: de yang khyad par gyi gzhi la de brjod de /
translated: Moreover, that is stated with respect to the basis of distinction.

original: khyad par brjod na khyad par gyi gzhi'i rigs su bsdus pa gzhan la khyad par de med par ston te /
analyzed: khyad par brjod na khyad par gyi gzhi'i rigs su bsdus pa gzhan la khyad par de med par ston te /
translated: If a specific attribute is mentioned, it shows that the other attributes of the basis are not present.

original: de ni gzhan mi ldan par nges bar gzung ba zhes bya ba'i gzhan gcod pa yin no ;
analyzed: de ni gzhan mi ldan par nges bar gzung ba zhes bya ba'i gzhan gcod pa yin no ;
translated: This is the exclusion of other called definite exclusion of non-possession.

original: / gang dag gzhi dang khyad par ngo bo gcig tu mi 'du ba dag kyang yod pa dang ldan pa'i sgo nas gzhi dang / khyad par du zhig la ldan par sgrub pa ste /
analyzed: / gang dag gzhi dang khyad par ngo bo gcig tu mi 'du ba dag kyang yod pa dang ldan pa'i sgo nas gzhi dang / khyad par du zhig la ldan par sgrub pa ste /
translated: There are also those that are not combined as one entity of basis and attribute, but are established as the basis and attribute through the door of existence and possession.

original: de brjod na ni 'brel ba nges par 'dzin cing ma 'brel pa rnam par gcod par byed de /
analyzed: de brjod na ni 'brel ba nges par 'dzin cing ma 'brel pa rnam par gcod par byed de /
translated: If they are mentioned, they ascertain the connection and eliminate the unconnected.

original: de dag ni dper na sngon po kho na autpal yod ces brjod na khyad bar gzhan gcod do //
analyzed: de dag ni dper na sngon po kho na autpal yod ces brjod na khyad bar gzhan gcod do //
translated: For example, if it is said, “Only blue exists as the utpala,” it excludes other attributes.

original: sngon po autpal kho na la yod ces brjod na gzhi gzhan gcod do //
analyzed: sngon po autpal kho na la yod ces brjod na gzhi gzhan gcod do //
translated: If it is said, “Blue exists only in the utpala,” it excludes other bases.

original: sngon po autpal yod pa kho na zhes brjod na sngon po autpal la yod pa nges par bstan pas med pa dang ma 'brel pa gcod de /
analyzed: sngon po autpal yod pa kho na zhes brjod na sngon po autpal la yod pa nges par bstan pas med pa dang ma 'brel pa gcod de /
translated: If it is said, “Only blue exists in the utpala,” since it demonstrates the ascertainment of blue existing in the utpala, it excludes non-existence and the unconnected.

original: de bzhin du tha dad pa dag la yang brjod do ;
analyzed: de bzhin du tha dad pa dag la yang brjod do ;
translated: The same holds for the other two cases.

original: / da la snga ma gnyis la ni skabs kyis ma nges par 'gyur ba yang yod do //
analyzed: / da la snga ma gnyis la ni skabs kyis ma nges par 'gyur ba yang yod do //
translated: In the first two cases, the force of the context determines the meaning.

original: ma 'brel pa gcod pa ni khyad par dang gzhi nyid la 'gal ba med na brnan pa'i tshig gis ma nges par ston pa'i nus pa med do //
analyzed: ma 'brel pa gcod pa ni khyad par dang gzhi nyid la 'gal ba med na brnan pa'i tshig gis ma nges par ston pa'i nus pa med do //
translated: When there is no contradiction between the specification and the general term, the particle eva does not have the force of specifying.

original: spyir brnan pa'i rigs su gtogs pa rnams tshig snga ma'i khyad par gcad pa dang / ngo bo gcod pa dang tha mi dad par sbyor ba dag skabs kyi stobs kyis shes par bya'o //
analyzed: spyir brnan pa'i rigs su gtogs pa rnams tshig snga ma'i khyad par gcad pa dang / ngo bo gcod pa dang tha mi dad par sbyor ba dag skabs kyi stobs kyis shes par bya'o //
translated: In general, the particle eva is used in two ways: to specify the word that precedes it, and to specify the meaning of the word that precedes it.

original: sgra las ni nus pa med do //
analyzed: sgra las ni nus pa med do //
translated: It is not used in the sense of excluding the general term.

original: gzhan yang brnan pa'i sgra tshig gi phrad du mi slu ba dag la 'jug pa yang yod do //
analyzed: gzhan yang brnan pa'i sgra tshig gi phrad du mi slu ba dag la 'jug pa yang yod do //
translated: Moreover, the particle eva is used in the sense of a verbal prefix, in the sense of non-deception.

original: skabs kyi mthus yin te /
analyzed: skabs kyi mthus yin te /
translated: This is due to the force of the context.

original: bstan par bya ba gang zhig kho na dang nyid kyi tshig gis bstan na don de bden par shes so //
analyzed: bstan par bya ba gang zhig kho na dang nyid kyi tshig gis bstan na don de bden par shes so //
translated: When the object to be expressed is specified by the words eva and eva, the meaning is understood to be true.

original: de ni tshig gi phrad du 'gog go //
analyzed: de ni tshig gi phrad du 'gog go //
translated: The particle eva is used to exclude other verbal prefixes.

original: gnyis pa zhes bya ba ni tshig zur gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa zhes bya ba ni tshig zur gnyis pa'o //
translated: The second is the second part of the word.

original: de ni 'di ltar byed pa dang las gnyis kar 'gyur du rung blta bu dang / yin pa dang yod pa gnyis kar 'gyur du rung ba lta bu ste /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar byed pa dang las gnyis kar 'gyur du rung blta bu dang / yin pa dang yod pa gnyis kar 'gyur du rung ba lta bu ste /
translated: It is like the word “doer” which can be used for both the doer and the action, and like the word “is” which can be used for both existence and non-existence.

original: 'di ltar gnyis kho na ni ma yin te gzhan dang gnyis zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar gnyis kho na ni ma yin te gzhan dang gnyis zhes bya'o //
translated: It is not only these two, but also others, such as “one” and “two”.🔽The word for one, the word for two,

original: gcig gi tshig dang gnyis kyi tshig / mang po'i tshig dang rtags can dang // zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gcig gi tshig dang gnyis kyi tshig / mang po'i tshig dang rtags can dang // zhes bya ba la /
translated: the word for many, the word with a suffix,

original: gcig tu ston pa'i tshig ni gcig gi tshig ste /
analyzed: gcig tu ston pa'i tshig ni gcig gi tshig ste /
translated: The word for one is the word that shows one.

original: de bzhin du gzhan la yang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan la yang sbyar ro //
translated: The same applies to the others.

original: de ni 'di ltar shing /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar shing /
translated: It is like this: “tree”,

original: shing dag / shing rnams zhes bya @242a * //
analyzed: shing dag / shing rnams zhes bya @242a * //
translated: “trees”, “all trees”.

original: ba ste grangs ston pa zhes bya ba'i tshig go //
analyzed: ba ste grangs ston pa zhes bya ba'i tshig go //
translated: This is the word that shows number.

original: rtags can ni rtags yod pa'i tshig ste /
analyzed: rtags can ni rtags yod pa'i tshig ste /
translated: The word with a suffix is the word with a suffix.

original: pho dang mo dang ma ning gi rtags gang zhig dang ldan na don gang rgya che ba dang / bya ba byed pa dang / sdud pa la sogs pa phyed pa dang mi byed ba dag gi sgra mtshon par byed pa dag go //
analyzed: pho dang mo dang ma ning gi rtags gang zhig dang ldan na don gang rgya che ba dang / bya ba byed pa dang / sdud pa la sogs pa phyed pa dang mi byed ba dag gi sgra mtshon par byed pa dag go //
translated: When a word has a male, female, or neuter gender, it is used to indicate what is extensive, what is an agent, what is a collection, and so on.

original: de dag dang bcas pa dang 'dren pa dang snang ba dang ldan pas so //
analyzed: de dag dang bcas pa dang 'dren pa dang snang ba dang ldan pas so //
translated: It is used to indicate what is not done, what is accompanied, what is led, and what is illuminated.

original: mtha' yi tshig dang dbus kyi tshig / ces bya ba ni gang zhig la gang zhig yod na mtha' 'dren pa dang dbus 'dren nus pa'i tha tshig ni mtha' dang dbus kyi tshig ste /
analyzed: mtha' yi tshig dang dbus kyi tshig / ces bya ba ni gang zhig la gang zhig yod na mtha' 'dren pa dang dbus 'dren nus pa'i tha tshig ni mtha' dang dbus kyi tshig ste /
translated: The words “end” and “middle” are words that can lead to the end and lead to the middle when something exists in something.

original: 'di ltar gzugs la sogs pa zhes bya ba dang / gzugs nas rnam par shes pa zhes pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar gzugs la sogs pa zhes bya ba dang / gzugs nas rnam par shes pa zhes pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, “form and so on” and “from form up to consciousness.”

original: nye dang ring la snyeg pa dang / mngon du ba dang lkog tu gyur /
analyzed: nye dang ring la snyeg pa dang / mngon du ba dang lkog tu gyur /
translated: Approaching near and far, manifest and hidden,

original: rab tu lkog la snyeg pa dang / zhes bya ba ni sgra gang zhig don gang nye ba dang / mngon du gyur pa la snyeg par byed pa dang gang zhig ring ba dang / lkog dang shin tu lkog tu gyur pa la snyeg par byed pa zhes sbyar ba'o //🔽de la don nye ba ni yul thug nye ba ste /
analyzed: rab tu lkog la snyeg pa dang / zhes bya ba ni sgra gang zhig don gang nye ba dang / mngon du gyur pa la snyeg par byed pa dang gang zhig ring ba dang / lkog dang shin tu lkog tu gyur pa la snyeg par byed pa zhes sbyar ba'o // de la don nye ba ni yul thug nye ba ste /
translated: The meaning of “remote” is that which is far away.

original: gang zhig la ltos nas 'di thag nye ba'o //
analyzed: gang zhig la ltos nas 'di thag nye ba'o //
translated: In relation to what is it far away?

original: yul gang shes pa'i mgon sum du gyur pa ni mngon du'o //🔽don 'dir gyur pa ni bshad pa 'am /
analyzed: yul gang shes pa'i mgon sum du gyur pa ni mngon du'o // don 'dir gyur pa ni bshad pa 'am /
translated: That which is the object of the cognition that is present is manifest.

original: 'chad pa'am gzhan yang rung ste 'di'o zhes bya bar brjod do //🔽ring ba ni yul thag ring ba ste /
analyzed: 'chad pa'am gzhan yang rung ste 'di'o zhes bya bar brjod do // ring ba ni yul thag ring ba ste /
translated: The meaning of “this” is that which is being explained, that which is being spoken about, or that which is being referred to.🔽“Far away” is that which is far away in terms of place.

original: gang zhig la ltos nas de thag ring ba zhes brjod pa'o //🔽lkog tu gyur pa ni mngon du byar mi nus pa'o //
analyzed: gang zhig la ltos nas de thag ring ba zhes brjod pa'o // lkog tu gyur pa ni mngon du byar mi nus pa'o //
translated: In relation to what is it far away?🔽“Hidden” is that which cannot be made manifest.

original: rab tu lkog tu gyur pa ni lo rgyus ma yin pas shes par mi nus pa ste /
analyzed: rab tu lkog tu gyur pa ni lo rgyus ma yin pas shes par mi nus pa ste /
translated: “Extremely hidden” is that which cannot be known through non-scriptural means.

original: de dag lkog tu gyur pas de zhes bya ba brjod do //
analyzed: de dag lkog tu gyur pas de zhes bya ba brjod do //
translated: Since they are hidden, they are called “that.”

original: de yang ngo bo nyid du dus dang tha snyad kyi dbye bas 'dren pa'i 'dra bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de yang ngo bo nyid du dus dang tha snyad kyi dbye bas 'dren pa'i 'dra bar 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, they are similar in that they are drawn out by the distinctions of time and convention in terms of their nature.

original: ngo bo nyid ston ba'i tshe na ni thag ring ba yul gang bdag dang ma 'brel pa dang / bdag gang zhig gis bzhag na de dang 'brel pa gzhan dang / mi brjod par mi nus pa dang ngo bo nyid bden pa dag la yang 'jug par byed de /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ston ba'i tshe na ni thag ring ba yul gang bdag dang ma 'brel pa dang / bdag gang zhig gis bzhag na de dang 'brel pa gzhan dang / mi brjod par mi nus pa dang ngo bo nyid bden pa dag la yang 'jug par byed de /
translated: When the nature is taught, it is not possible to not speak of that which is distant, that is, a place that is not connected to the self, that which is connected to another, that is, a self that is not established, and that which is not possible to express. It engages the truths of nature.

original: 'di ltar 'brel pa'am ma 'brel pa dag 'brel pa ni skyes bu gzhan dang skyes bu gzhan no //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'brel pa'am ma 'brel pa dag 'brel pa ni skyes bu gzhan dang skyes bu gzhan no //
translated: Thus, whether connected or not connected, they are connected to another person and another person.

original: de'i skyes bu bya bas brjod pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: de'i skyes bu bya bas brjod pa lta bu'o //
translated: It is like the expression “the person of that.”

original: ming brjod par mi nus pa ni gsang bar 'os pa mi ston par 'doms pa ni de ma ston cig ces brjod pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ming brjod par mi nus pa ni gsang bar 'os pa mi ston par 'doms pa ni de ma ston cig ces brjod pa lta bu'o //
translated: That which is not possible to express by name is like the instruction not to teach that which is suitable to be hidden, saying, “Do not teach that.”

original: ngo bo @242b nyid bden pa la 'jug pa ni 'di nyid bden pa yin pa la de kho na zhes bya bas brjod pa ste /
analyzed: ngo bo @242b nyid bden pa la 'jug pa ni 'di nyid bden pa yin pa la de kho na zhes bya bas brjod pa ste /
translated: Engaging the truths of nature is saying “that itself” with regard to that which is true.

original: de dag ni tshig gi phrad du 'dod do //
analyzed: de dag ni tshig gi phrad du 'dod do //
translated: These are held to be the verbal particles.

original: de ltar na dngos po bden pa dang gsang ba dang bdag gi ba dang pha rol po la 'jug par byed pa na de zhes bya ba 'di dag dus gsum char mi sel to //
analyzed: de ltar na dngos po bden pa dang gsang ba dang bdag gi ba dang pha rol po la 'jug par byed pa na de zhes bya ba 'di dag dus gsum char mi sel to //
translated: Thus, when one engages in the real, the secret, the mine, and the other, this is not eliminated in any of the three times.

original: gal te bstan par bya ba dus nyid yin te /
analyzed: gal te bstan par bya ba dus nyid yin te /
translated: If the object of expression is time itself,

original: dus can la ni da ltar sel to //
analyzed: dus can la ni da ltar sel to //
translated: then the possessor of time is eliminated in the present.

original: dus can yin na bdag nyid sel te /
analyzed: dus can yin na bdag nyid sel te /
translated: If it is the possessor of time, then the self is eliminated.

original: dus dang dngos po la 'jug pa'i stobs kyis phye ba ni tshig gi phrad du 'gog pa'i phyir dus sel bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dus dang dngos po la 'jug pa'i stobs kyis phye ba ni tshig gi phrad du 'gog pa'i phyir dus sel bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Since the distinction by the power of engagement in time and entity is negated by the verbal particle, time is not eliminated.

original: 'dir ni gang tha snyad kyi dbang du brjod pa 'das pa dang / rnam grangs gzhan la brjod pa yang rung ste /
analyzed: 'dir ni gang tha snyad kyi dbang du brjod pa 'das pa dang / rnam grangs gzhan la brjod pa yang rung ste /
translated: Here, whatever is expressed under the power of convention, whether it is expressed in the past or in another category,

original: gang zhig gi skabs su bstan par bya ba'i don yod pa dang tshig lhag ma dang bcas par 'gyur pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: gang zhig gi skabs su bstan par bya ba'i don yod pa dang tshig lhag ma dang bcas par 'gyur pa gzung ngo //
translated: whatever is the object of expression in that context, that which exists and has a remainder of words, is taken.

original: de la 'das pa ni sngar brjod pa ste /
analyzed: de la 'das pa ni sngar brjod pa ste /
translated: Among those, the past is what was previously expressed.

original: de yang 'das ma thag pa dang / lan grangs gzhan la brjod pa yang rung ste /
analyzed: de yang 'das ma thag pa dang / lan grangs gzhan la brjod pa yang rung ste /
translated: Moreover, it is either immediately past or it is mentioned in another passage.

original: gang zhig gi skabs su bstan par bya ba'i don gang zhig yin pa ni de zhes bya bas ston par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gang zhig gi skabs su bstan par bya ba'i don gang zhig yin pa ni de zhes bya bas ston par rig par bya'o //
translated: Whatever is the topic and whatever is the meaning to be taught, that is indicated by the word “that.”

original: 'dri dang lan gyi tshig dang ni //
analyzed: 'dri dang lan gyi tshig dang ni //
translated: The words of question and answer,

original: bdag dang gzhan dang sbyor ba'i tshig / ces bya ba la /
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan dang sbyor ba'i tshig / ces bya ba la /
translated: the words of self and other, and the words of application.

original: 'dri ba'i tshig ni gang dang / ji ltar dang / gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'dri ba'i tshig ni gang dang / ji ltar dang / gang zhe na /
translated: The words of question are “what,” “how,” and “which.”

original: gang gi phyir zhe na /🔽gang gi zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhe na / gang gi zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: “Why” is the word of question.

original: dri bar byas nas gang zhig gi tshig rnam par sbyar zhing mjug sdud pa'i lan du 'gyur ro //🔽bdag gi tshig ni yin byed kyi mtha' can dang byed pa'i rkyen la sogs pa dag gi ngo bor ston pas brjod pa'o //
analyzed: dri bar byas nas gang zhig gi tshig rnam par sbyar zhing mjug sdud pa'i lan du 'gyur ro // bdag gi tshig ni yin byed kyi mtha' can dang byed pa'i rkyen la sogs pa dag gi ngo bor ston pas brjod pa'o //
translated: Having asked, “which,” the words of the answer are applied and summarized.🔽The words of self are the words that indicate the nature of the ending in -ta and the conditional particle and so on.

original: gzhan gyi tshig ni don gzhan dang 'bru mang po la sogs pa tshig rang gi don mi ston par rnams kyi brjod pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi tshig ni don gzhan dang 'bru mang po la sogs pa tshig rang gi don mi ston par rnams kyi brjod pa'o //
translated: The words of other are the words that do not indicate their own meaning, such as the words of other meanings, many syllables, and so on.

original: sbyor ba'i tshig ni tshig rnam par sbyar ba thams cad de /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i tshig ni tshig rnam par sbyar ba thams cad de /
translated: The term application refers to all the applications of verbal roots.

original: 'di ltar ming gang la yin pas sbyar ba dang / yod pas sbyar ba dang / de la phan pas sbyar ba dang / byed pas sbyar ba dang / las kyis sbyar ba dang / 'dra bas sbyar ba dang / ngo bos sbyar ba dang /
analyzed: 'di ltar ming gang la yin pas sbyar ba dang / yod pas sbyar ba dang / de la phan pas sbyar ba dang / byed pas sbyar ba dang / las kyis sbyar ba dang / 'dra bas sbyar ba dang / ngo bos sbyar ba dang /
translated: For example, there are applications by means of being, by means of existing, by means of benefit, by means of action, by means of object, by means of similarity, by means of essence,

original: dngos po'i rkyen yis sbyar ba lta bus ming de rnam par sbyar te /
analyzed: dngos po'i rkyen yis sbyar ba lta bus ming de rnam par sbyar te /
translated: and by means of the condition of a thing.

original: de la ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: 'di ltar yin pas sbyar ba ni yin par sbyar ba ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar yin pas sbyar ba ni yin par sbyar ba ste /
translated: Application by means of being is application by means of being.

original: de bzhin du gzhan la yang brjod par bya'o //🔽@243a * // de la yin par sbyar ba ni dper na skyes bu 'di'i ming lhas byin zhes bya'o zhes pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan la yang brjod par bya'o // @243a * // de la yin par sbyar ba ni dper na skyes bu 'di'i ming lhas byin zhes bya'o zhes pa lta bu'o //
translated: The same should be said for the others.🔽Application by means of being is, for example, the statement, “The name of this person is Devadatta.”

original: yod par sbyar ba ni dper na skyes bu 'di la brtul ba yod pas 'di'i ming brtul ba zhes bya'o zhes pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: yod par sbyar ba ni dper na skyes bu 'di la brtul ba yod pas 'di'i ming brtul ba zhes bya'o zhes pa lta bu'o //
translated: Application by means of existing is, for example, the statement, “Since this person exists, his name is Bhavya.”

original: de la phan par sbyar ba ni dper na skyes bu 'di don grub pa la phan pa'i mthu nye bar sgrub pa yin pas 'di'i ming don grub ces bya'o zhes pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: de la phan par sbyar ba ni dper na skyes bu 'di don grub pa la phan pa'i mthu nye bar sgrub pa yin pas 'di'i ming don grub ces bya'o zhes pa lta bu'o //
translated: Application to benefit is, for example, Since this person has the power to accomplish benefit, his name is Accomplished Benefit.

original: byed par sbyar ba ni dper na skyes bu 'di mi rnams dga' bar byed ba yin pas 'di'i ming dga' bo zhes bya'o //🔽zhes pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: byed par sbyar ba ni dper na skyes bu 'di mi rnams dga' bar byed ba yin pas 'di'i ming dga' bo zhes bya'o // zhes pa lta bu'o //
translated: Application to action is, for example, Since this person delights people, his name is Nanda.

original: las su sbyar ba ni dper na skyes bu 'di la mi rnams kyis nye bar bsngags pa yin pas 'di'i ming nye bar bsngags pa zhes bya'o zhes pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: las su sbyar ba ni dper na skyes bu 'di la mi rnams kyis nye bar bsngags pa yin pas 'di'i ming nye bar bsngags pa zhes bya'o zhes pa lta bu'o //
translated: Application to karma is, for example, Since people praise this person, his name is Praised.

original: 'dra bar sbyar ba ni dper na skyes bu 'di lha dang 'dra ba yin pas 'di'i ming lha zhes bya'o zhes pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'dra bar sbyar ba ni dper na skyes bu 'di lha dang 'dra ba yin pas 'di'i ming lha zhes bya'o zhes pa lta bu'o //
translated: Application to similarity is, for example, Since this person is like a god, his name is God.

original: ngo bor sbyar ba ni skyes bu 'di skyes bu yin pas 'di'i ming skyes bu zhes pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ngo bor sbyar ba ni skyes bu 'di skyes bu yin pas 'di'i ming skyes bu zhes pa lta bu'o //
translated: Application to essence is, for example, Since this person is a person, his name is Person.

original: dngos po'i rkyen du sbyar ba ni skyes bu'i dngos po 'di skyes bu nyid yin pas 'di'i ming skyes bu nyid do //
analyzed: dngos po'i rkyen du sbyar ba ni skyes bu'i dngos po 'di skyes bu nyid yin pas 'di'i ming skyes bu nyid do //
translated: The application of the condition of entity is as follows: since the entity of a person is a person, its name is person.

original: de ltar tshig rnam par sbyar ba de rnams kyi nang du ni sngar bstan pa kun kyang 'du bas ming gang yang de dag tu rnam par sbyar zhing gang zhig tu mjug bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar tshig rnam par sbyar ba de rnams kyi nang du ni sngar bstan pa kun kyang 'du bas ming gang yang de dag tu rnam par sbyar zhing gang zhig tu mjug bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: Since all of the above are included among these applications of words, any name can be applied to them and included among them.

original: de rnams kyang kha cig ni de dag tu ston pa'i rkyen gyi yi ge dang ldan no //
analyzed: de rnams kyang kha cig ni de dag tu ston pa'i rkyen gyi yi ge dang ldan no //
translated: Some of these are endowed with the syllables of the condition of teaching them.

original: kha cig ni skabs kyi stobs kyis so //
analyzed: kha cig ni skabs kyi stobs kyis so //
translated: Some are by the power of the context.

original: de ltar na sum cu rtsa lnga ste /
analyzed: de ltar na sum cu rtsa lnga ste /
translated: Thus there are thirty-five.

original: rgyas pa dang bsdus pa dag ni ma nges pa dang / gang yang sgra dag ni 'di tsam kho na zhes nges par gzung ba ni med de /
analyzed: rgyas pa dang bsdus pa dag ni ma nges pa dang / gang yang sgra dag ni 'di tsam kho na zhes nges par gzung ba ni med de /
translated: The extensive and the condensed are indefinite, and there is no definite enumeration of the sounds,

original: gzungs dang spobs pa mi zad pa dang / so so'i skye bo'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzungs dang spobs pa mi zad pa dang / so so'i skye bo'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are not the domain of ordinary beings and because retention and eloquence are inexhaustible.

original: de'i phyir 'dir bstan pa sum cu rtsa lnga'o zhes so //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir bstan pa sum cu rtsa lnga'o zhes so //
translated: Therefore, here there are thirty-five that are taught.

original: de dag ni byed pa'i tshig dang ldan pas bye brag tu ston pas dus byed pa dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni byed pa'i tshig dang ldan pas bye brag tu ston pas dus byed pa dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: They are related to the verbal root, and so they are related to the time of the action.

original: mdor na skabs kyi mthu dang ldan pa dag ni bsdus nas rtogs par gyur ro //
analyzed: mdor na skabs kyi mthu dang ldan pa dag ni bsdus nas rtogs par gyur ro //
translated: In brief, those that are related to the power of the context are understood through inclusion.

original: byed pa'i tshig dang ldan pa dag gis ni mi ldan pa dag kyang rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byed pa'i tshig dang ldan pa dag gis ni mi ldan pa dag kyang rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Those that are related to the verbal root are understood even when they are not related.

original: dus kyis 'dom pa sel ba de dag kyang gzhan gcod pa'i tshig dang ldan na khyad par gyi sgrar 'gyur te /
analyzed: dus kyis 'dom pa sel ba de dag kyang gzhan gcod pa'i tshig dang ldan na khyad par gyi sgrar 'gyur te /
translated: Those that remove the measure of time become words of distinction when they are related to the words of exclusion of another.

original: rang dang nyid lta bu ni mthun pa'i thun mong mi srid pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rang dang nyid lta bu ni mthun pa'i thun mong mi srid pa'i phyir /
translated: Like the words “self” and “itself,” they are not possible as common synonyms.

original: de dang ldan na rang 'ba' zhig gam khyad par du @243b 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dang ldan na rang 'ba' zhig gam khyad par du @243b 'gyur ro //
translated: When they are related, they become only the self or a distinction.

original: de mi ldan pa dag ni thun mong dag kyang srid pa'i phyir khyad par nyid du ston pa'i nus pa med do //
analyzed: de mi ldan pa dag ni thun mong dag kyang srid pa'i phyir khyad par nyid du ston pa'i nus pa med do //
translated: Those that are not related are possible as common synonyms, and so they lack the power to indicate a distinction.

original: dus kyi 'dom pa sel ba zhes bya ba sbyor ba gnyis pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: dus kyi 'dom pa sel ba zhes bya ba sbyor ba gnyis pa rdzogs so /
translated: This completes the second chapter on the removal of the measure of time.

original: // / da ni bsal ba de dag gi dgos ched bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: // / da ni bsal ba de dag gi dgos ched bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to teach the purpose of those exclusions,

original: rigs dang dus bsal byas nas ni //
analyzed: rigs dang dus bsal byas nas ni //
translated: Having excluded the type and time,

original: bstan bya gang zhig ston pa de //
analyzed: bstan bya gang zhig ston pa de //
translated: Whatever is to be taught is taught.

original: de ni ched du 'dod pa yin //🔽zhes smos te /
analyzed: de ni ched du 'dod pa yin // zhes smos te /
translated: That is the purpose.

original: de la sgra de dag rang gi tshig gi don ji lta bu ston pa dag gi gzhan bsal te /
analyzed: de la sgra de dag rang gi tshig gi don ji lta bu ston pa dag gi gzhan bsal te /
translated: There, those words exclude others of whatever their verbal meaning is.

original: don de dag nyid bstan pa ni ched yin te /
analyzed: don de dag nyid bstan pa ni ched yin te /
translated: Teaching just those meanings is the purpose.

original: de ni sgra sbyar ba'i dgos pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni sgra sbyar ba'i dgos pa yin no //
translated: That is the purpose of applying the words.

original: de'i dbye ba ni dus sel ba'i sgra yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i dbye ba ni dus sel ba'i sgra yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: Its division should be understood as the words that exclude time.

original: ched du bya ba'i sbyor ba'i sbyor ba zhes bya ba gsum pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: ched du bya ba'i sbyor ba'i sbyor ba zhes bya ba gsum pa rdzogs so /
translated: The third chapter is completed called “The Application of Purpose.”

original: // / sbyor ba bzhi pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: // / sbyor ba bzhi pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the fourth application,

original: ji snyed don gyi sbyor ba ni //🔽gang la 'jug pa bstan pa ni //
analyzed: ji snyed don gyi sbyor ba ni // gang la 'jug pa bstan pa ni //
translated: The application of the extent of the meaning🔽Is the teaching of the engagement.

original: gang gis ston pa'i yi ge de //
analyzed: gang gis ston pa'i yi ge de //
translated: The letters by which it is taught

original: de ni ming du btags pa yin //🔽zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de ni ming du btags pa yin //🔽zhes gsungs te /
translated: Are designated as the name.

original: ming du btags pa ni sngon gyi slob dpon gyis de ltar ston pa'i sbyor ba de'i ming ni de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: ming du btags pa ni sngon gyi slob dpon gyis de ltar ston pa'i sbyor ba de'i ming ni de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The name is the name of the application taught by the former masters.

original: ming ji snyed yin pa ni sngar bstan pa'i ming dag yin no //
analyzed: ming ji snyed yin pa ni sngar bstan pa'i ming dag yin no //
translated: The number of names is the names taught above.

original: ming du btags pa'i sbyor ba zhes bya ba bzhi ba rdzogs so /
analyzed: ming du btags pa'i sbyor ba zhes bya ba bzhi ba rdzogs so /
translated: The fourth chapter on the application of naming is completed.

original: // / gang zhig rnam smin rnam bral rnam pa'i shes pas mi reg cing //
analyzed: // / gang zhig rnam smin rnam bral rnam pa'i shes pas mi reg cing //
translated: That which is free from the result of maturation is not touched by consciousness.

original: brjod min brjod dang ldan min brjod pas reg min kyang /
analyzed: brjod min brjod dang ldan min brjod pas reg min kyang /
translated: It is not expressed, it is not endowed with expression, it is not touched by expression.

original: brda ru btags pas brjod pa gsal te de nyis rnam pa brjod gyur nas //
analyzed: brda ru btags pas brjod pa gsal te de nyis rnam pa brjod gyur nas //
translated: But it is expressed by the designation of a sign, and when it is expressed in that way,

original: rnam pa'i shes pas rnam bral khong du chud la phan pa'i 'di gzigs te ;
analyzed: rnam pa'i shes pas rnam bral khong du chud la phan pa'i 'di gzigs te ;
translated: it is understood to be free from consciousness. The Sage sees this benefit.

original: / thub dbang sras dang bcas pas skye bo mthun par btags pa bstan par mdzad //
analyzed: / thub dbang sras dang bcas pas skye bo mthun par btags pa bstan par mdzad //
translated: The Lord of Sages and his sons have taught this designation for beings.

original: gdags pas brgyud phyir tha snyad gzugs kyis bstan de ston pa dag //
analyzed: gdags pas brgyud phyir tha snyad gzugs kyis bstan de ston pa dag //
translated: Because it is designated by convention, it is taught by the form of designation.

original: skye bo grags so shin tu 'khrul pas khrid pa rnams //
analyzed: skye bo grags so shin tu 'khrul pas khrid pa rnams //
translated: Beings are greatly misled by what is well known.

original: don la rnam pas 'dzin cing rnam pa brjod 'dzin pa ;
analyzed: don la rnam pas 'dzin cing rnam pa brjod 'dzin pa ;
translated: In reality, the form is grasped by the form, and the form is grasped by the expression.

original: / brjod pa ming du btags 'dzin tha snyad de la gzugs su rtog //
analyzed: / brjod pa ming du btags 'dzin tha snyad de la gzugs su rtog //
translated: The expression is grasped by the name, and the conventional is conceived as form.

original: tha snyad 'jug pa tsam yang med pa dag //
analyzed: tha snyad 'jug pa tsam yang med pa dag //
translated: Those who do not even have mere engagement in convention

original: byis pa ku dang thun mong 'di byas pas //
analyzed: byis pa ku dang thun mong 'di byas pas //
translated: are made to be like children and fools.

original: de dag sgra dang don la mkhas gyur te //🔽rnam bral brjod med don la 'jug gyur cig //
analyzed: de dag sgra dang don la mkhas gyur te // rnam bral brjod med don la 'jug gyur cig //
translated: By this, may they become skilled in sound and meaning,

original: smra ba thams @244a * //
analyzed: smra ba thams @244a * //
translated: and may they engage in the inexpressible meaning free from conceptual elaborations.

original: cad la 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i sgra'i bstan bcos kyi 'grel pa sbyor ba bzhi dang ldan pa slob dpon chen po su bh'a sha k'i rtis ngo bo gcig tu brjod pa'i gzhung du mdzad pa rdzogs so//
analyzed: cad la 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i sgra'i bstan bcos kyi 'grel pa sbyor ba bzhi dang ldan pa slob dpon chen po su bh'a sha k'i rtis ngo bo gcig tu brjod pa'i gzhung du mdzad pa rdzogs so//
translated: The commentary on the treatise on sound called Engaging All Speech, composed by the great master Subhutirtha as a single text with the four applications, is complete.
